intro: Mulgedium qinghaicum, commonly known as the Qinghai mulgedium, is a perennial herb native to the Qinghai region of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky slopes, adapting to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive scent when crushed, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. Mulgedium qinghaicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
